Notes.Text:
This update for memcached fixes the following issues:

Security issue fixed:

- CVE-2019-11596: Fixed a NULL pointer dereference in process_lru_command (bsc#1133817).
- CVE-2019-15026: Fixed a stack-based buffer over-read (bsc#1149110).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP1

Vulnerabilities.Description: In memcached before 1.5.14, a NULL pointer dereference was found in the "lru mode" and "lru temp_ttl" commands. This causes a denial of service when parsing crafted lru command messages in process_lru_command in memcached.c.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP1:memcached-1.5.6-4.5.30
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP1:memcached-devel-1.5.6-4.5.30

Vulnerabilities.Description: memcached 1.5.16, when UNIX sockets are used, has a stack-based buffer over-read in conn_to_str in memcached.c.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP1:memcached-1.5.6-4.5.30
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP1:memcached-devel-1.5.6-4.5.30
